item.title: Cooperation | Meeting with 50 consular representatives
item.description:
The Chief Executive had dinner on Friday with representatives of consulates of about 50 countries and international organizations to those who stressed the mission of establishing an international cooperation platform. Sam Hou Fai stressed the importance of strengthening economic, commercial and cultural ties
The Government of MSAR organized a reception and dinner on Friday, which was attended by representatives of consulates generals of about 50 countries and international organizations. In the speech at the reception to the representatives, Sam Hou Fai said that "Macau is committed to building an international cooperation platform", and a "high quality abroad opening platform." The leader of the MSA has indicated that the goal is to make Macau "in an important window for mutual exchange and learning between Chinese civilization and Western civilization." Addressing the international guests, Sam Hou Fai pointed to economic and commercial cooperation, cultural exchange and the connection of people between Macau and those countries, and ensured that its executive will articulate with the national development strategy, “with the driving force the innovation of legal regimes and the optimization of policies”. The goal is to “coordinate the common progress of the government and the market, from Macao and the world, in favor of building a more inclusive, more convenient, and more effective international exchange platform”. Sam Hou Fai also linked the commitment of his executive in the “reform of public administration, the constant elevation of the efficiency of governance, the innovation of the concept of serving”, and in the creation of “an environment that further facilitates the lives of people and companies”. The ruler also indicated that all countries and regions are welcome to take advantage of the role of Macao as an international cooperation platform, and invited "companies and tourists from all countries" to "experience the vitality of the development of Macao and China." Widen the circle The chief executive also mentioned some of the typical political concepts of MSAR, such as the idea that the principle "one country, two systems" "demonstrates worldwide notable successes." After highlighting the imperative need to ensure sovereignty and national security, Sam Hou Fai highlighted the importance of ensuring “fully a high degree of macao autonomy, keeping the capitalist system and their way of living, its status of International and Autonomous Customs, and the Continental European Law System in Macau”. The head of executing said that "Macau is willing to share development opportunities with all countries and regions, widening the" circle of friends "to achieve increasingly comprehensive cooperation."

item.title: Restoration | Law that regular licensing will be reviewed
item.description: The government intends to review various legal diplomas in the area of ​​commerce and business, and the 1996 law review, regarding the licensing of food and beverage and bars establishments, will be one of the first to be reviewed, together with the 1998 law that “regulates administrative conditioning of certain economic activities”. In addition, the 2013 cultural heritage safeguarding law will also be reviewed in order to “guarantee the interests of consumers, the values ​​of cultural heritage, the safety in construction and fire safety”. The information is in response to Deputy NGAN Iek Hang's written interpellation signed by the Director of Services for Justice Affairs, Leong Weng In. The director states that the review of these diplomas aims to “reduce the negative impacts that relevant legislation can cause to the business environment, namely regarding the start of business activity”. The executive also wants to bet on the electronization of services for companies, namely the “constitution of commercial companies”, “certificate of admissibility of firm” and “initial registration of commercial entrepreneur and singular person”. This system is in the test phase and should be launched “gradually on the platform for companies and associations [in the single account] in the second and third quarter of this year”.

item.title: Work | Insurance sector with higher wages and vacancies
item.description: Data from the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) confirm that the insurers 'sector is on the rise, both in the number of vacancies and the average workers' salary. At the end of the first quarter of this year, there were a total of 821 workers in insurance companies, plus 1.1 percent compared to the same period last year, and in March the average remuneration was 34,480 patacas, plus 3.3 percent. The increase in average remuneration, within the financial sector, was higher for financial intermediation activities, in the order of 5.5 percent. Thus, in March, a worker in this segment earned an average of 30,270 patacas. In global terms, the average remuneration of workers in full time of the financial activities sector was 32,020 patacas, plus 2.7 percent, in annual terms. At the end of the first quarter there was a 0.7 percent break in the number of bank workers, which had a total of 7,193 employees. This is a reduction of 53 people. In terms of the number of vacancies available at banks, there were 202, eight minus less terms. However, in the insurance segment, the number of vacancies increased by seven, totaling 41.

This amount adds to the 946 million renminbis paid before the Zhuhai authorities, by granting the land. According to the information shared by the University of Macao subsidiary (one) at the Portal of the Directorate of Supervision and Management of Public Assets (DSSGAP), studies are a requirement to receive the permanent license of land use on Mountain Island. Only after these works are finished will advance with the works that should have a cost of the thousands of millions of Renminbis. The study in question was commissioned to the Zhuhai representation of the China Nonferrous Metal Industry Changsha Reconnaissance Design & Research Institute, a multinational from China, which also has activity in countries such as United States, Japan or Germany. Among the 2.95 million Renminbis, the company of UM admits that a first payment of 2.17 million has been made and that the remaining amount of 780,000 Renminbis will be paid "when conditions are gathered." In the report, the amount declared with investment in land and construction of assets is 976 million renminbis, although these expenses are not discriminated against, so they may take into account other costs, in addition to the previously announced 946 million Renminbis through the newspaper or Mun. In terms of operational spending, the company spent 359,000 renminbis on seal tax in the interior of China, and paid 84,000 land use tax renminbis for a total of 443.2 thousand renminbis. Previous costs are added 80 thousand renminbis paid to intermediates, defined as management expenses, in addition to the payment of financing of 576 thousand Renminbis. At the level of the expense recognized by Guangdong Hengqin, a Higher Education Development are also given donations of 100,000 Renminbis, although the recipient is not indicated. About 10,000 students According to the plans previously announced by one, the land of the future campus is divided into nine lots, of which six will be used to build laboratories, colleges, and other university facilities. The mission is to build an international campus on Mountain Island, with the seal of the Government of MSAR, facing teaching and research in the areas of science, engineering, agriculture and medicine. At least 10,000 students are expected on the campus that is expected to be completed by 2028, the year they will start operations with 8,000 students, including 4,000 to attend undergraduate degrees. The campus is also expected to need about 500 employees to operate, and it is not yet clear whether one will choose local residents or give Chinese residents priority.

item.title: How can Macau be saved?
item.description: The dead have no voice, but the act of suicide talks about misfortune. We cannot cover our ears and pretend we don't hear, nor to cover our eyes and pretend we don't see. The life of each person is precious and unique and one case of suicide is too much. In response to recent suicide cases and the discovery of corpses, the MSAR Social Action Institute (IAS), together with the competent government departments and social service organizations, has held the “exchange meeting - let's play the role of life guardian, cherishing people around us”. At this meeting, the president of IAS reported that 18 cases of suicide had occurred in the first quarter of 2025, a decrease of four compared to the same period last year. Without a decrease in suicide cases, IAS would not have hurried to hold this meeting. Statistics does not explain everything, but it is in reality that the best explanation is found. To tell a beautiful story about Macau just have some skill, but being able to identify the problems and find a solution is what really matters. If the RAE government does not take practical measures to improve citizens' living conditions and thus restore their trust in the future, tragedies will continue to happen. Even though the coverage of suicides made by the media is an echo of the guidelines “six things to do and eight to avoid” of the IAS, or even if nothing is mentioned, it is believed that cases of unnatural deaths continue to increase. Polishing the golden image of Macao and releasing the city from misfortune is no difficult task. Just have the same consideration for the lives of the residents that are held by the members of our family, to face their concerns as if they were ours, and to work consciously and responsibly to protect the subsistence of the people, promoting employment. At that time, all problems will be solved. Only when social and survival conditions are guaranteed can the country be safe. Macau's economy is currently affected by various factors and the situation is not favorable. Among them, there are several social problems that were not effectively communicated or resolved through the appropriate means. Maintaining stability through the use of high -pressure tactics and a chimerical prosperity are mere illusions. When they fall to the ground, illusions naturally lead to a dead end. In fact, as long as the RAE government shows determination and take the necessary measures, Macau can save itself. Since the game's recipes fell short of expectations and a lot of large -scale construction projects are underway, it is true that the RAE government is facing some financial pressure; Otherwise, this year civil servants would not have had frozen salaries. But with financial reserves accumulated over the years, the RAE government can concentrate capital investment in the development of various projects. And with the synergy effect, Macao's economic problems can be solved. When the economic situation and living conditions improve, Macau residents will naturally prosper and find joy in their lives. In order to improve people's subsistence conditions and create more job opportunities for residents, I throw the following suggestions. For example, transforming the space of the old Jockey Club into the "Jockey Club Fun Land", taking the land of "Oceanis Park" in the mud, left to abandon, for an "Ocean tea house" or an "Ocean night market" with typical Chinese and Portuguese elements, creating a "Integrated Activities Center" in Seac Pai Van and their surroundings, with services daytime. Also, interconnecting the schools in zone A of new urban landfills to create a “school city”, expedite the transformation of the place of the Galgos de Macao Race Company (Yat Yuen) into a “sports garden for citizens”, introducing a one -year subsidies program for young residents and encouraging free schools and governmental schools to provide job opportunities for the younger ones. If the Macao government is concerned with its citizens, and scrupulously respect the principle that foreign workers should only be welcomed to supply the lack of labor, reinforce the promotion of the responsible game and minimize all negative factors that affect citizens' mental health, will become the best “guardian of life”.

item.title: Concert | Bruno Pernadas in Macau and inland in June
item.description:
June will be filled for Portuguese multi-instrumentalist and composer Bruno Penadas, who, in partnership with the Noyb Association (None of Your Business), star in several concerts in Macau, Hong Kong and other stops from southern China. Lush sounds can hear in Shenzhen on the 12th; in Macau the next day, and then in Zhuhai and Hong Kong
The Noyb Association (None of Your Business) is preparing to bring, next June, the tour of Bruno Pernadas, “The Greatest Bay Area Tour 2025”, with concerts in Shenzhen, Macau, Zhuhai and Hong Kong. Thus, the Portuguese, Chinese and other nationalities can listen and closely see the creations of the Portuguese multi-instrumentalist and composer, presenting a journey of sound mergers that wanders between “jazz, futuristic pop, folk, electronics and psychoadelical rock”. According to a Noyb press note, Bruno Pernadas is a "master of sound alchemy, creating vibrant and immersive landscapes that challenge categorizations, making their concerts an unforgettable experience." “Your fluid approach between genres, combining intricate arrangements with global influences, will take the audience on a musical trip where retro-futurizing melodies meet hypnotic rhythms, and where each note tells a story. More than a series of concerts, this event is a cultural bridge between Portugal and the big bay,” says Noyb. Highlight for the fact that the concert in Macao will take place two days after June 10 - Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese Communities, and the whole month is dedicated to celebrating Portuguese culture and language. All songs in one The raid of Bruno Penas into the music world was through the real Lisbonense Combo and groups such as the "Julie & The Carjackers" or "Minta & The Brooktrout". The first album was titled "How Can We Be Joyful In A World Full of Knowledge?" And was released 11 years ago. This was followed by “Those Who Throw Objects at the Crocodiles Will Be Asked To Retrieve Them” in 2016, and since then it has been added success. Highlight for the release, in 2021, of the album work “Private Reasons”, which ends the sound trilogy created in 2014 and 2016. Later this year, Bruno Pernadas released “Worst Summer Ever”, also creating several sound bands for dance, theater and cinema. Speaking to the Lisbon Cultural Agenda, Bruno Pernadas spoke of the diversity of musical styles that are present at the work he does. “There is no genre that describes the song I make. I sing like anyone, the only difference is that I know the notes I'm singing, but I don't have it. I prefer to play instruments much more.”

item.title: FRC | Debate on technology use next Wednesday
item.description: It will take place next Wednesday, at the Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC), the session “Screen Generation: Navigating Without Limits” [Blue Wave Generations: Surfing Without Limits]. The event aims to discuss the impact of navigation, without limitations, on digital screens, especially in mobile phones and new technologies. The session, a joint organization of the Association of Young Macanese (AJM), University of São José (USJ) and the Rui Cunha Foundation, will focus on the way excessive time in digital screens affect health and well-being, especially the younger generation, and how it can affect the educational system in Macau, as well as what can be done to balance and manage time (with or without screen), including Introduction of Artificial Intelligence in our near future. Jacky Ho, director of USJ's Faculty of Health Sciences and “Macao Observatory for Social Development”, is the guest speaker of this event, who will present the theme in this session, moderated by Jerusa Antunes, Vice President of AJM. item.title: HK / Alliance Française | Session about Mark O'Neill's new book
item.description: The Alliance Française de Hong Kong will feature, next Wednesday, at 6.30 pm, the event dedicated to talking about the latest book by writer and journalist Mark O'Neill, entitled “Europeans in Hong Kong” [Europeans in Hong Kong]. The session, named “Rencontre Avec Mark O'Neill:‘ Europeans in Hong Kong ”. According to the official presentation of the event, it will talk about how the communities of European nationalities, including members of the Macanese community, shaped local society and developed various community and social support initiatives. “In nineteenth-century Hong Kong social pressures led to the abandonment of many women, the vulnerable. The Les Soeurs of Saint-Paul Congregation, arrival in Hong Kong in 1848, offered refuge [to poor people],” and between 1848 and 1897 supported more than 34,000 children, mostly Chinese and girls. "This act of compassion represents one of the most significant European contributions to Hong Kong," he describes. Mark O'Neill was born in London, UK, and has been living in Hong Kong for many years. He was a journalist and since 2006 he has been dedicated to writing full time, having already launched 12 books on social and cultural issues in the region and China, including biographical works.

item.title: TSI | Confirmed suspended arrest of six months to doctoral student
item.description: The Court of Second Instance (TSI) confirmed the sentence to six months in prison to the student at a local university, who tried to corrupt the thesis advisor with 8 thousand patacas. Confirmation of the conviction was released on Friday by the courts of MSAR. The penalty was suspended for two years, due to the payment of 15 thousand patacas to the MSAR. Despite entering an unidentified local college in August 2020 and having as a deadline for the delivery of the PhD Thesis May 2023, the student only began to discuss the structure of work with the advisor in March 2023. Presenting a project that did not meet the advisor's requirements, and in view of the prospects of not being approved, the student placed an 8,000 -borrowed red envelope inside a book Advisor, leaving this book in the advisor's mailbox. However, the teacher refused the offer and eventually complained to the authorities. This was not the student's first monetary offer to the teacher. In 2020, the student had offered valleys and money to the tutor, who, in turn, refused the offer and warned the student that the behavior was illegal and possibly constituted the crime of corruption. With the following case to the courts, the first instance sentenced the student for the crime of active corruption, with a sentence of arrest of six months, suspended for two years, and the payment of 15,000 patacas to the MSAR. The defendant resorted to the conviction for arguing that the money had been offered to “obtain more academic guidance” and never with the purpose of corrupting the teacher to facilitate the approval of the thesis. However, the TSI declined the arguments and maintained the condemnation of the first instance.

item.title: Economy | Inflation in Macau is 0.23% in April
item.description:
The consumer price index in Macau rose 0.23 percent in April, in annual terms. The section of leisure, recreation, sport and culture was the one that recorded the largest monthly price increase, 2.47 percent, due to the inflation of the hotel rooms. In the first four months of the year, the price index grew 0.17 percent compared to the same period as 2024
Last April the Consumer Price Index (IPC) rose 0.23 percentage points compared to April 2024, and 0.16 percent compared to the previous month, according to data released on Friday by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). Prices of the leisure, recreation, sport and culture section increased by 2.47 percent compared to April 2024, mainly driven by the climb of hotel room prices. The price index of the food products and non-alcoholic beverages grew 0.48 percent in the month under analysis, "thanks to the climbing price of meal acquired away from home and" Take-Away "," the same source added. In monthly terms, the prices of non-alcoholic food and beverages have slightly descended from March (0.04 percent), because the additions of meal prices acquired outside the home and “take-away” did not completely compensate for fresh fish prices, fresh and fruit products and fruit products ”. Spring-summer fashion With regard to housing and fuels, DSEC data demonstrates an annual climb was 0.21 percent due to an increase in home rents. In the section of clothing and footwear, DSEC indicated that prices rose 0.78 percent in April compared to the previous month, "thanks to the launch of summer clothing." Still, in annual terms the clothing and shoe section fell 2.35 percent. While in transport the monthly climb was 0.42 percent due to “the increase in airplane ticket prices”, although annual comparison, a break of 1.67 percent was verified. On the other hand, in the fourth month of the year, an annual drop in information and communication prices (-3.01 percent) was recorded, a section that also registered a monthly break of 0.07 percent. DSEC also indicated that in the 12 months ended in April, the IPC rose 0.42 percent over the immediately preceding 12 months. During this period, the sections that “had the most notable additions” were various products and services (+2.47 percent), education (+2.21 percent) and health (+1.62 percent). In the opposite direction, transports fell 3 percent.

item.title: Traffic | Tourist crosses road off the treadmill and is run over
item.description: A interior tourist had to be transported to the Conde São Januário Hospital Center, after crossing Avenida de Almeida Ribeiro off the treadmill. The accident happened around 11:30 am, when the wife and a friend decided to cross the road, ending one of them for being hit by a TCM bus. As a result of the accident, the woman was transported to the hospital with head injuries, although she had kept conscious. The bus got the cracked front glass. Despite the injuries, both the injured tourist and the friend, were eventually fined by the authorities, for crossing the road off the treadmill. The accident led to the TCM company to issue a statement to explain the situation. According to the company's version, the driver was surprised by two women who appeared behind other vehicles that followed the road, which did not have enough time for the driver to lock. The company also indicated that after the accident the response mechanisms were activated for these situations, with the driver calling the rescue teams and the police. The accident became viral, with several images online, including the victim bleeding on the road. Some of the images were altered using artificial intelligence, to show the two tourists dance in the middle of the road, which did not correspond to reality.

item.title: Startup transforms tea residues into paper, packaging and furniture
item.description: A Macao-based 'start-up' has created a business based on tea plantations in China, which recycles on paper, shopping bags, glasses, toothbrushes, electronic and even furniture sheets. Zence Object Holding already has more than 20 active projects in areas such as interior decoration, beverage packaging, among others, which develops with various customers, who are also partners, namely restaurants, hotels and conference centers. Every year, China produces about 100 tons of tea waste, which end in the trash, according to the China's annual report of China in 2023. On the other hand, the country produces about 200 million tons of plastic waste annually, according to a UN report by 2023. Zence has seen in the need to “solve global waste problems” an opportunity, seeming perfectly the idea of ​​turning tea waste into recycled ecological materials. The company founded in 2023, with a capital of six million patacas, expects to reach the return on investment next year and be profitable in 2028. "A ton of tea residues can give rise to ten tons of tea-based bioplastic, flexible and versatile like plastic," the company's co-founder Bob Hou Keung told Lusa. The same weight of tea residue can make 150 table tops, or cluster panels with size 120x60x1.8cm, which can be used in the “direct replacement of the majority of wood panels”, with the “triple of the hardness of cement”, added the entrepreneur. Cooperation with neighbors About a ton of tea waste per month, coming directly from a tea plantation from Fujian province, one of China's largest tea -producing provinces, is sent to two Zence factories in Guangdong province, Lei said. The industrial process integrates technologies of modification of biological -based plastics and mixture of vegetable fibers, biomaterial modification, production and manufacture. "After gathering the tea residues, we process them, sterilize them, we begin to turn them into a grain-shaped tea-based bioplastic, which after melting is shaped by a machine," the businessman explained. Law stressed that tea residues “can be decomposed 100 percent natural”, “without formaldehyde” and “neutral in terms of carbon”. A cup of coffee, for example, contains 10 percent pure tea leaves with vegetable polymers and polyhydroxialcanoates (PHA)-natural biodegradable polymers, “buried in the ground, and can completely decompose within 60 to 90 days,” he said.

item.title: Health | Number of doctors and nurses per inhabitant without increases
item.description: Data from the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) disclosed by Health Services (SS) show that between 2023 and 2024 there was no increase in the number of health professionals in the territory in terms of the average of doctors or nurses per number of inhabitants. Thus, at the end of last year there was an average of 3 doctors (2.9) per thousand inhabitants; 1 doctor (1,1) of traditional Chinese medicine (MTC) for every thousand people; Less than one dentist or dentist (0.4) for every 1,000 people and still about 4 nurses per thousand inhabitants (4.44). These are “data similar to those of 2023,” says DSEC. Still, and in global terms, Macau registered 50 more doctors enrolled in annual terms, totaling 2,030; plus 732 traditional Chinese medical doctors or registered traditional Chinese medicine masters, an increase of only four, in annual terms; and a reduction of two registered dentists, in a total of 304. In turn, the territory gained another 78 nurses within one year, with 3,058 registered in late 2024. In terms of the number of beds there were, at the end of last year, 1,779 beds in the five local hospitals, a reduction of 103 in annual terms “mainly due to the transfer of beds to sick”. Inpatient beds increased by 96 units compared to 2023, but their 71.5 percent use rate recorded a homologous decrease of 2.3 percentage points. Noteworthy, in these statistics, for a light rise of 0.5 percent, between 2023 and 2024, of the care in the emergency services of all hospitals, in a total of 463 thousand.

item.title: Zape | Seized 651 tobacco packs in convenience stores
item.description: Following a complaint, the Office for prevention and control of smoking and alcoholism of health services seized 651 cigarette packs in two convenience stores in the Zape area. According to a statement released yesterday by the services DER HEALTH, it was found that the stores had a large amount of cigarettes whose labeling was not in accordance with the legal provisions of Macao. In one of them, 159 packs were found (totaling 3180 cigarettes) and the other 492 packs (totaling 9840 cigarettes). Those responsible for the convenience stores in question did not show import documents. Tobacco was seized by customs services and health services will follow the case and, if the offense is confirmed, those responsible for stores can be punished with a fine up to 200,000 patacas. Health services have reiterated that "to ensure residents' health, Macau law rigorously regulates the circulation of tobacco products, appealing to traders not to risk luck or challenging the law, otherwise they are severely punished."

Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim committed himself and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story." Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J. item.title: ASEAN | Malaysia calls for the largest union in the face of US tariffs
item.description: Southeast Asia should accelerate economic integration, diversify markets, and remain united in the face of disturbances in global trade resulting from US tariffs, said the head of Malaysian diplomacy yesterday. Malaon Foreign Minister Mohamad Hasan spoke during the opening of the first annual summit of heads of state and government of the Association of Southeast Asia Nations (Asean) in Kuala Lumpur. "ASEAN countries are among the most affected by US -imposed tariffs. Trade war between the US and China is drastically disturbing production and commerce standards around the world," said Mohamad. The diplomat even admitted that "it is likely that there is a global economic slowdown." "We must take advantage of this moment to deepen regional economic integration, so we can better protect our region from external shocks," added Mohamad. ASEAN countries, many of which depend on exports to the US, are suffering from tariffs ranging from 10 percent and 49 percent. Six of the association's ten member countries were among the most affected, with tariffs ranging from 32 percent and 49 percent. ASEAN has unsuccessfully attempted to mark an initial meeting with the US as a block. ASEAN's unit is crucial, as the region deals with the impacts of climate change and the disturbance caused by the use of artificial intelligence and other unregulated technologies for criminal purposes, Mohamad said. The diplomat added that Asean, whose rotary presidency belongs to Malaysia, will be tested by external pressure, including a rivalry between superpowers. "External pressures are increasing, and the scope of challenges has never been so big," said Mohamad. "Therefore, it is crucial that we reinforce the bonds that unite us, so that they do not disqual to external pressures. For Asean, unity is now more important than ever," he said.

item.title: Gaza | Israelite attacks have been 52 dead since Saturday
item.description: At least 52 people have died in the Gaza range since early Saturday morning due to Israelite air strikes, Palestinian news agency Wafa said. On Saturday night, an Israeli Defense Forces Drone (IDF) attacked a family business in the Al Hakr neighborhood of Deir Al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip, killing five Palestinians. At night, the Israelite Air Force also launched attacks on communities east of Khan Yunis in the south of the Gaza Strip, where several IDF helicopters have also opened fire. In the north of the enclave, air strikes and “intense shots” were reported by the Israeli forces in various places, including Beit Lahia and the northeast of Jabalia. Local and doctors had already advanced the deaths of at least eight more people in the city of Gaza and seven more in Rafah, in the south of the track, where about 60 people were also injured. The worst nightmare The attacks appear after the Hamas Government Ministry of Health, in the Gaza Strip, registered 79 dead on Friday, including nine children of a pediatrician who was working at the hospital when the bodies arrived. According to Hamas, pediatrician Alaa Al Najjjjaros was working at Nasser Hospital in Khan Youis (southern Gaza) when the bodies of nine of his 10 children (Yahya, Rakan, Raslan, Jibran, Eve, Rivan, Luqman, Sadeen and Sidra) arrived after being killed in an attack on their home. Pediatrician's husband, Hamdi Al Najjar, and the only surviving son, Adam, both seriously injured, are being treated in the intensive care unit. The images released after the attack by QDS News Network show Hamdi on the stretcher with bass burns. The oldest of the deceased children was 12 years old, according to the director general of the Ministry of Health of Gaza, Munir Al-Bursh. The rescue video of the bodies shows the Gaza Civil Defense agents and the Crescent Palestinian red to remove the children's charred bodies from the house, one after another. "She left them to do their duty and mission to all children who do not find another place at the Nasser Hospital, which is full of innocent screams and weakened by the disease, hunger and tiredness," wrote the doctor, Youssef Abu Al Rish, in a note released yesterday by health services. Updated data yesterday, by the Ministry of Health they raise to more than 53,900 the number of people killed in Gaza since Israel launched an offensive. The war broke out in Gaza after an unprecedented attack by the Palestinian Islamite group Hamas on Israeli soil on 7 October 2023, which caused about 1,200 dead and more than two hundred hostages.

item.title: Pyongyang | Three leaders after accident with war ship
item.description:
The launch of a new war ship was marked by an accident that affected the boat's hull, allowing the water to enter, and which led to the cancellation of the ceremony
North Korea detained three leaders under an investigation into an accident on Wednesday during the release ceremony of a new war ship. "The authorities detained Kang Jong Chol, chongjin shipyard engineer, Han Kyong Hak, head of the hull building workshop, and Kim Yong Hak, vice-director of administrative affairs," said the group that is analyzing the incident, quoted on Saturday by KCNA. The North Korean official news agency said leader Kim Jong-un, who was present at the release ceremony of the five thousand tons in the port city of Chongjin, described the accident as a "criminal act." On Friday, the KCNA had said that an underwater and internal inspection of the war ship "confirmed that, contrary to what was initially announced, there was no gap in the bottom of the ship." However, "the stroke hull was scratched and a little sea water entered the stern section by the emergency exit," the agency added, ensuring that the damage suffered by the "not serious" war ship. "No more damage to the war ship" and "the rehabilitation plan is advancing as scheduled," KCNA said on Saturday. According to the US and South Korea information services, the “side launch attempt” of the ship has failed. The Fatherworthy is currently inclined in the water, the South Korean military said. Satellite images from the site showed the ship lying on the side, with most of the submerged hull and covered by blue covers. In search of balance Hong Kil-ho, the shipyard director where the accident occurred, was summoned by a military commission on Thursday, KCNA added. North Korean experts estimate that “two or three days to restore the balance of the war ship that pumps water from the flooded section,” the agency said. The repair of the hull of the Freemaker should take about ten days, he added. The name of the boat was not specified. In April, Pyongyang released images of a five thousand tonword -filed ship, called Choe Hyon. At the time, state media transmitted Kim images to participate in a ceremony with their daughter, Kim Ju-AE, that many experts believe it will be the successor in power. North Korea claimed that the ship was equipped with the "most powerful weapons" and "would enter service early next year." According to some experts, Choe Hyon may be equipped with short -range tactical nuclear missiles, although North Korea has not yet proven to develop small nuclear weapons. Public recognition of technical or administrative failures is highly unusual in North Korea.

item.title: Brazil | Chinese company GAC starts sales of electric and hybrid vehicles
item.description: Chinese car manufacturer GAC wants to sell up to eight thousand electric and hybrid vehicles in Brazil this year and 29,000 by 2026, as well as establishing a production line that has described as comprehensive. GAC, the sixth largest car builder in China, said on Friday, at an event in Sao Paulo, which will start selling four models in 83 dealers, although the goal is to reach 120 points of sale by the end of the year. The models range from price from 169 thousand reais (26,300 euros), the cheapest, up to 350 thousand reais (54,500 euros), the most expensive. GAC President Feng Xingya said in a statement that they will produce cars “with the most modern technologies in the world” and that Brazil is now a “priority market” for them. Xingya added that the company's mission is to make the sector more competitive and align it with the principles of green mobility and energy efficiency. The company, which operates in approximately 70 countries and produces more than two million cars annually, has promised to create an innovation and development center in the South American country to support operations. The company's executives announced last week during a meeting with Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, who will invest $ 1.3 billion in the country, without specifying a deadline. Chinese rival Byd announced in late 2024 that it planned to start producing electric vehicles in Brazil from March, with the purpose of manufacturing 150,000 units throughout the year, a number that would double by 2026. The Brazilian government has sought to increase investment in the production of less polluting vehicles through a tax incentive program.

item.title: Hong Kong | Patriots at a party from 1 to 5 June
item.description: Hong Kong's patriotic groups will hold a party a party for the third consecutive year, supported by the territory government, which coincides with another anniversary of the events of 1989 in Beijing in Tiananmen. The event takes place from June 1st to 5th in Parque Victoria, which for more than three decades, until 2019, was the place of annual vigils to mark Tiananmen. Rock Chen, from the Zhejiang United Residents Association, told the Hong Kong South China Morning Post newspaper that the program and the place are “the same as in previous years”, stressing that “there is no intention to overshadow the birthday” of June 4, 1989. This year, Carnival will include “experiences of innovation and technology, a sports competition, as well as traditional culinary delights and cultural shows of cultural shows several Chinese provinces ”.

item.title: Commerce | Beijing and Berlin want stable economic relations
item.description:
Xi Jinping and Friedrich Merz spoke on the phone to hit needles about trade between the two nations and reinforce the economic connections between China and the European Union
China and Germany defended Friday the establishment of “stable and predictable” ties between Beijing and Berlin, involving the European Union (EU), with the German chancellor stressing the importance of “loyal competition” in economic relations. According to a spokesman for Friedrich Merz's government, and in the first telephone conversation with Xi Jinping, the German chancellor insisted on “loyal competition”, but also in “reciprocity” between the two powers, at a time when the intense trade between China and Germany is full of geopolitical and economic tensions. For his part, Chinese President Xi Jinping, created by the state -owned news agency Xinhua, appealed to Merz to establish “stable and predictable” ties between Beijing and Berlin, as well as with the European Union. "The correct status on relations between China and Germany and between China and the European Union is that of partners," said XI, adding that "a stable and predictable political environment is an important guarantee of bilateral cooperation." Xi Jinping also appealed to Germany to open more bilateral investments between the two countries. "I hope Germany will provide more political support and facilities for bilateral investment cooperation, as well as a fair, transparent and non -discriminatory business environment for Chinese companies," said Xi Jinping. Merz, for his part, also urged Beijing to support peace efforts in Ukraine, underlining the "desire to work in partnership to face global challenges." "The two leaders discussed the War of Russian aggression against Ukraine. The chancellor reported on joint efforts from Europe and the United States to reach a quick ceasefire. He asked these efforts to be supported," according to a German government press release. On Thursday, after a telephone conversation with Xi, French President Emmanuel Macron assured the Chinese counterpart that he shared "the same goal regarding the war led by Russia": "A lasting and solid peace [which] begins with an immediate and unconditional ceasefire." Exchange of materials At a time when the intense trade between China and Germany is full of geopolitical and economic tensions, Merz stressed the importance of “loyal competition” and “reciprocity” between the two powers during his meeting with XI. Many subsidized Chinese products are flooding Europe, and the German market in particular, raising concerns about impact on local industry. These products range from electric cars, supported by state subsidies, to cheap Chinese solar panels, as well as the current iron arm on steel. For his part, Xi asked Germany to give more support for bilateral investment, according to Chinese state press.

item.title: Timor-Leste | Permanent prohibition permanent martial arts
item.description: The Prime Minister of Timor-Leste, Xanana Gusmão, admitted yesterday the possibility of permanently banning the practice of martial arts in the country, considering that they continue to divide young Timorese. "It's all going well, although there is still problems in some places. That's why today (yesterday) I proposed that, in the Council of Ministers, we look at the best way, that it may really end it, because this issue is dividing young people," said Xanana Gusmão. "We are both siblings [direct cousins], but only because we belong to different martial arts groups, we have to get away and we are no longer well," lamented the prime minister. The head of the Timorese government spoke to journalists after a meeting with President José Ramos-Horta at the Presidency Palace in Dili, before the meeting of the Council of Ministers. Xanana Gusmão also showed concern for young people's behavior, noting that security reports indicate that problems continue to occur, including physical aggression, and argued that there is therefore a decision to make a decision. On Tuesday, during the National Flag Içar ceremony, under the celebrations of the 23rd anniversary of the Restoration of Independence, confrontations between young people caused a dead at the CAILACO Administrative Post, in the municipality of Bobonaro. According to the Timor-Leste National Police, the young people involved in the clashes belonged to two martial arts groups, who have been in conflict since Monday, having also attacked the home of a veteran. In early April, the government of Timor-Leste decided to extend the suspension of teaching, learning and practice of martial arts by the end of 2025 to continue to consolidate social peace and ensure that in the future the practice of martial arts stems exclusively in sports.

item.title: Seoul | Pyongyang fired cruise missiles to the sea
item.description: The South Korean army said North Korea yesterday fired unidentified cruise missiles to the sea, hours after Pyongyang admitted a "serious accident" with a new war ship. The South Korean joint staff said it had detected the missiles near the Southern Hamgyong Province in eastern North Korea, which were fired towards the Japan Sea. The launch took place hours after the official North Korea press had advanced with a "serious accident" that occurred during the release ceremony of a war ship. During the release ceremony of a five-ton-ton setback in the port city of Chongjin, “a serious accident occurred,” said the North Korean official news agency KCNA. item.title: Philippines | President requires government resignation
item.description: The president of the Philippines, Ferdinand Marcos Jr., demanded yesterday the resignation of all members of the government, after having obtained a worse result than expected in the interchange elections of May 12. Marcos Jr. “requested the dismissal by courtesy of all office secretaries,” said the presidential palace in a statement, a measure that aims to give the president “the margin of maneuver necessary to evaluate the performance of each department and determine who will continue to serve”. The order was taken after the candidates supported by Marcos Jr. to the Senate, the Alta Chamber of the Philippines Parliament, had fewer places than expected in the interchange elections held on May 12. "The people spoke and expect results, no political maneuvers or excuses. We hear them and we will act," said the president. The elections were marked by the dispute between the candidates of Marcos Jr. and those supported by the vice president and former Alleada Sara Duterte. The vote came months after the father, former President Rodrigo Duterte (2016-2022), was extradited to be tried for crimes against humanity by the International Criminal Court due to war against drugs. Despite being detained in The Hague, Rodrigo Duterte was reelected as Mayor of Davao, in Mindanao, in southern Philippines, a position he held before running the head of state. The presidency said yesterday that government services “will remain uninterrupted” during the transition, during which it will evaluate the performance of the current secretaries before deciding whether or not they will be replaced. Falling The son of the late dictator Ferdinand Marcos (1917-1989) is three years old until the end of his term and, according to the statement, ministerial renewal represents "a new phase totally focused on the most urgent needs of the population." To date, more than a dozen of the 23-time secretaries have dismissed or announced their intention to abandon the position, together with agency leaders under the control of the president, such as Manila's Metropolitan Development Authority. Among them was Finance Secretary Ralph G. Recto, who, in a statement, praised the “bold decision” made “with the desire to give priority to people and the country”. Energy Secretary Raphael Lotilla noted that the order of resignation is "an excellent opportunity to take stock and invigorate the government." The measure was taken after the president recognized on Monday that the bad results of the elections were due to the disappointment of the Philippines with the government's performance. Marcos Jr.'s approval rate fell to 25 percent, according to a survey held in March, a sharp drop from the 42 percent rate in February. The interviewees pointed to the government's failure to control inflation, unbridled corruption in the country and the lack of measures to combat poverty.

item.title: Rui Leão, architect and co-author of “Layering the City” | A four -hand city
item.description:
Architects Rui Leão and Carlotta Bruni have accumulated many drawings over the years, which have now been materialized in “Layering the City”, a work that was released last week at the Venice Architecture Biennial. The book results from two lives dedicated to architecture and two doctoral theses defended at the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
How does the initiative come to publish “Layering the City”, which makes the retrospective of your work a little? This project is born from a dialogue between my dissertation thesis and Carlotta [Carlotta Bruni's] dissertation thesis, who both take different aspects of our contribution as architects to Macau, to the city. And therefore, the project of this book is the encounter of these two theses. The title of the book refers to the idea of ​​a town in layers. No, what happens is that in the case of our views, my and Carlotta, there is work brought by each one to the project, and which gives a response to the programmed request, what the client asks, to what lives in the alignment plant [of the project], or a series of questions at civic, public space or the right to quality of life. There are a number of social dimensions [to take into account] to make spaces for people, even when they are impossible [in terms] of politics and in the city. It is these layers that go into the projects and that, deep down, are creating opportunities to qualify the life of the city, the person, the street. And this has nothing to do with those who pay, it has to do with the management that the architect makes in the city through the project. It is these layers, the layers, in which the architect is enriching what is the project's offer to the city and creates several micro-projects within this larger project, which qualify the ride, social spaces and public space in a way that was not requested. Therefore, in a project of architecture always persists the idea of ​​the people and the spaces they inhabit. In the case of Macau there is this extreme situation where the public space is always the minimum, with a narrow walk, and where everything is resolved. Because there is a lack of more public space profile in the city, this management done by the architect through the project turns out to be a way to compensate for the city, to reconcile people with it, or the opposite. The cover of the book refers to Fai Chi Kei's public housing project. I assume that they consider the project one of the great milestones of your studio. Undoubtedly. This was the first large housing building in collective terms, where we had the opportunity to apply ideas that we had developed to the public space, in Praça do Lago, or even in the park next door. All of these projects have a lot of involvement with the public space and this was our first initiative with a housing program. We did a number of super important experiences that allowed us to demonstrate that it was possible to qualify public housing. We produce a series of gardens, packets, air gardens in various floors [from the building]. We were collecting the floors two to two and four to four to create communities inside the building, almost like a Chinese pharmacy that has drawers, social interaction sites since the bottom floor, and so on. All of this has been worked with small public terraces present throughout the project, and in this respect, it is very innovative. It is, in fact, a demonstration that, whether it is a housing building or a museum, it can indeed contribute to the qualification of people's lives. Any [architecture program, in order to order or contract] it serves for the architect to act on the project. What other projects are in this book? We have the Barra station and the intermodal zone [related to the light meter]. There are two projects, for us, very important, because they also come to reconfirm the ability to overlap many and many layers. In the case of Barra Station, there is also a public park on top, and the two marginals, the historic and the new. It is an all -glass, transparent project that allows me to be on the side of the slaughterhouse and see the river and boats through the glass. The building turns out to be a kind of octopus that makes ground level connections, with the gardens around the season that connect with the roof. There is a certain complexity, in which almost a new city system is created and there is at the same time a trial overlap of the train, buses and the passing people. The book also has projects that are not yet built. What was it like to combine the content of your doctoral thesis with that of Carlotta Bruni? The book consists of texts by some critics about our work. There is a text by Jorge Figueira, for example, and a great interview conducted by Ana Vaz Milheiro [Academic] and then has our texts. Is there a presence by architect Manuel Vicente in this work? Manuel Vicente is very present, because some of these projects were made in partnership with him. Therefore, there is a continuity of these first projects for those who came next, already without Manuel Vicente, and who is very polished for us. Deep down, it has to do with what we not only inherited, but what we brought with us from Manuel. Presenting this work at the Venice Architecture Biennial, and considering that the MSAR is also represented with an exhibition, is it important for your work and visibility of the studio? Yes. The idea of ​​publication, with Barcelona's Actar Books, has to do with putting the work, and more than that, its message, which is very specific to Macau and our way of working in the international and architects community, and this goes a lot through the Biennial. It was also in Europe that a consensus was built on the level of descriptions [in architecture] for a few centuries, and where there is a discussion, national and international, around the issues of the profession. We want our work to be present, either through the book and through acting Books, in this international community, to be part of the world. Leaves and layers “Layering the City” intends to establish with the international community of architects and passionate about the profession a dialogue showing the last years of work and the vision of the LBA - Rui Leão and Carlotta Bruni's architecture and planning. The work is born of the intersection between two doctoral theses of the two architects: “Designing by Increments: Opportunistic Planning as Urban Strategy for Macau” (by Rui Leão) and “Shaping Macau’s Unpurposed Space: Design in Context” (by Carlotta Bruni). According to a book presentation, "LBA's intellectual contributions are evidenced through the space narratives that integrate complex urban contexts with culturally sensitive design strategies." The two architects and their team "emphasize the importance of creating spaces that harmonize with their surroundings, while responding to the functional needs of modern urban life." It is therefore a “particularly relevant approach in Macao, where the juxtaposition of the old and the new is a defining characteristic of the city”, it reads.

item.title: Álvaro Barbosa, vice-rector of the University of São José: “Student visa is very limiting”
item.description:
The University of São José continues the negotiation saga with the Chinese authorities to recruit students from the interior of China. Vice-rector Álvaro Barbosa expects, soon, the increase in master's students from 30 to 200. Regarding the internationalization of higher education, the official advocates changes in student visas to facilitate recruitment
Does the recruitment of students from the interior of China remain a matter pending to the University of Saint Joseph? It is a process that is underway. We have had huge support from the Macao government in negotiations to obtain the quota for our university, and they have been tireless in the effort to try to resolve the issues raised by the central government. Many of the questions are legitimate and concern concerns that arise. We were granted a temporary quota of 30 students for masters ago over a probative period, which served to evaluate how we, as Western University, would host students from China. From China, there is this concern with the host of students in Macau. I think we have made a huge effort and the students who are there, included in this contingent, are quite satisfied. Is this quota for masters just? Yes. For a degree we do not have authorization yet. In this way, we are currently at the time we try to overcome this probative period in order to obtain a quota of about 200 students for masters. We are in the final phase of the evaluation process and everything has been doing well. We will have the possibility that, next academic year, expand this quota. That would be great, because for our university, to have a greater impact of our mission in Macao, it is essential to have access to students from mainland China. We cannot be a university in an integrated region in a country like China, and not contact with students from China. Is it more difficult for USJ to compete with other universities, such as those of Hong Kong, by foreign students, outside China? The issue of recruitment of international students has become a priority for Macao universities. In the last two or three years, it has become evident that this internationalization is very important. What difficulty is there? There is the issue related to student visas, as these visas currently do not allow students to do any kind of work, denying them that minimum local subsistence mechanism to be able to meet expenses. Nor is it contemplated the possibility of, when the student concludes his formation, to be in the territory and find work. What all countries and regions that are competitive in higher education do, such as Singapore, Hong Kong or Australia, is to have incentive policies. Allow students to work part -time, for example. In Hong Kong when a degree ends, the student can stay in the territory up to a maximum of two years to find a job. This kind of measures do not yet exist in Macau, but I think the government is pondering this possibility. From the moment the decision was made that the internationalization of higher education was important, this must be accompanied with the corresponding measures. The current student visa is extremely limiting and does not encourage the coming to Macao to study, only allows coming. This issue was not as present as it is now, but now there is a strategic policy of internationalization. It is also a matter of survival for local universities. Yes. Perhaps there is no greater example of a catalyst for the diversification of Macau's economy than higher education. We have ten institutions, 60,000 students in about 700,000 inhabitants. This is the potential of internationalization, to foster diversification.
And also the research that comes out of higher education. The investigation, the dynamics of the work that is done. There are a number of vectors that higher education brings to a region or country, this happened to Portugal, for example, with the policy of doctoral scholarships for students from abroad, which completely changed the dynamics of higher education. Cape Verde developed thanks to the impact of higher education. Then we need to make the system more flexible in Macau. I don't know if it's a matter of having a holistic view of strategy. There may be an idea, but then it does not intervene in all the necessary dimensions to achieve a certain goal. But I am very optimistic. I believe this new student policy is a key step to be taken in Macau. The internationalization strategy followed by all these countries and regions I spoke, and were successful in capturing international students, was always the same. No need to invent much. First, one should increase the capacity and notoriety of universities, and then a policy of scholarships, which will enhance a student flow, creating a reference for the territory, so that studying there becomes a habit. After this flow of students for a few years, an image is already created and some scholarships can be removed, which students will continue to choose a particular territory to study in it. Australia has a huge higher education industry, for example, and I think that in Macau we just have to follow the same strategies. We do, at USJ, that a little. How, in concrete terms? We offer many scholarships, and in this sense the Diocese of Macao has helped us build this flow of international students that allow us to create this dynamic that we hope will be sustainable by itself in the future. I think the government is also doing this. There have always been scholarships in Macau, attributed mainly by the Macau Foundation, but this measure will be strengthened. Solving the student's visa issue, creating a scholarship incentive system for five to ten years, Macau will have a bright future as an international higher education destination. But we need to invest, continue, and it takes a few years. USJ created the “Macau Hub” platform, in partnership with the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in 2023. At what stage is this project? This project has to do with our interest in developing a relationship dynamic of Lusophone countries centered in Lisbon in the area of ​​entrepreneurship, first. This cabinet we have at CCCM is not intended to offer training in Portugal, but we want to do something else. As we are positioned in the Great Bay and with Hengqin, where it is intended to activate a business ecosystem, we want to take advantage of the fact that we have relations with the Lusophone world to activate the access of the startups of Portugal, Brazil and Angola, above all, to the great bay and hengqin. We are trying to create a kind of incubator of transnational companies, in which we support the development of Lusophone businesses that want to settle in the large bay and also the reverse system. Strategically, for a university, it is absolutely fundamental to have a dynamic in the area of ​​entrepreneurship. Currently, more than half of our students do not want to go to the corporate world, but create their own businesses. Just as universities have to have employability solutions, they also have to have them for entrepreneurs, who are increasingly. So a university has to have a business incubator. My vision of the future for higher education goes around: a university, besides having a library and canteen, will also have its own business incubator. I would say that most students of management or economy courses dream of having their own business, especially in China. China is perhaps one of the most entrepreneurial countries in the world. The CCCM welcomes this initiative in Portugal, but we also work with the Portuguese Catholic University. And concrete results, already have it? We have a number of small initial projects that are starting now, and we also work with many business organizations. We have now negotiated a series of projects, and I think everything will develop very quickly, based on the manifestations of interest we have. We were in Angola in December and we have already aligned a series of initiatives, we also have projects with Brazil and Portugal.
